The report also mentioned that the public and various stakeholders were in favor of the change. Taking public opinion into account, the Commission drafted the outline for the next process. This public support strengthened the position of moving forward with the proposal.
targetText: Public consultation showed strong support for renaming the Assembly as 'Welsh Parliament'. This backing strengthened the case for moving forward with the proposal.

sourceText: Regarding the AM title, the Commission supported 'Welsh MPs' or WMP, but the public consultation received the most support for the MWP option. This shows that the public and members find this option more appropriate and acceptable. The Commission considered this difference while preparing further decisions and recommendations.
targetText: While the Commission favored 'Welsh MPs', public consultation preferred MWP. The feedback guided further recommendations and decisions.

sourceText: It is clear that AMs are suggesting several other options, but it is proving difficult for Presiding Officer Elin Jones to reach consensus. However, she expects that the legal draft for the changes will be presented within a few weeks. During this process, various proposals and suggestions are being considered so that the final decision is satisfactory to all parties.
targetText: AMs proposed several options, making consensus difficult for Elin Jones. The legal draft is expected soon after reviewing all suggestions.

sourceText: The law being prepared for changes also includes further modifications in how the Assembly works. These changes include clarifying rules for AM disqualification and preparing a new committee system format. This will ensure the Assembly operates more systematically and transparently. At the same time, the new rules will clearly define members duties and responsibilities.
targetText: The new law will clarify AM disqualification rules and update committee structures. It aims to make the Assembly more systematic, transparent, and clear on members' duties.

sourceText: During debates on the legislation, AMs will finally vote on what they should be called. This process will decide the title of members positions through a democratic method. The voting results will clarify which option most members support. In this way, the final decision will be fully based on members opinions and consent.
targetText: AMs will vote democratically on their titles during debates. The final decision will reflect the majority opinion and members' consent.

sourceText: The people of Macedonia are going to hold a referendum to change the country name. The aim is to decide the country name democratically by knowing public opinion. After discussion and debate on various name options, the final decision will be taken. This process gives citizens a chance to participate directly in national identity and decision-making.
targetText: Macedonia will hold a referendum to decide its new country name. Citizens can directly participate in shaping national identity through discussion and voting.

sourceText: On Sunday, voters will vote on whether to change their country name to Republic of North Macedonia. The vote will determine whether the public supports this change. This process ensures direct participation of citizens. The results will play a crucial role in deciding the country national identity and future direction.
targetText: Voters will decide whether to rename the country Republic of North Macedonia. The outcome reflects public support and guides the nation's future identity.

sourceText: A famous referendum was held to resolve a decades-old dispute with neighbor Greece. The dispute arose because a region in Greece is also named Macedonia. Because of the name, both countries clashed over identity and cultural rights. The referendum was expected to provide a peaceful and democratic solution to this issue.
targetText: The referendum aimed to resolve a long-standing dispute with Greece over the name Macedonia. It offered a democratic solution to cultural and identity conflicts.

sourceText: Athens has long insisted that the name of its northern neighbor creates confusion with its own province named Macedonia. For domestic politics and international identity reasons, Greece has repeatedly opposed its neighbors membership in the EU and NATO. Greece believes that having the same name sends wrong messages about cultural and historical rights. Therefore, diplomatic talks and negotiations continue to resolve the dispute.
targetText: Greece opposed its neighbor using the name Macedonia, citing confusion and cultural concerns. Diplomatic negotiations continue to resolve the issue.

sourceText: A rival of the name-change referendum, the Macedonian President, said he would ignore the vote. He argued that the publics decision on this issue is neither complete nor valid in his view. The President stance could increase controversy and political debate. This shows that political differences over the name-change proposal remain deep.
targetText: The Macedonian President opposed the referendum, claiming it was invalid. Political divisions over the name-change remain significant.

sourceText: However, Prime Minister Zoran Zaev and supporters of the referendum argue that the name change is only a way to join the EU and NATO. They say it will strengthen the country international identity and diplomatic relations. They believe the name change will end the old dispute and make the country more influential globally. Therefore, supporters consider this change a necessary step for future opportunities and development.
targetText: Supporters, including PM Zoran Zaev, say the name change allows EU and NATO membership. They see it as a step to strengthen international identity and global influence.

sourceText: Due to decreasing churches in Harlem, the sound of St. Martins bells is now heard less. Earlier, bells rang every hour or on special occasions, but now they are heard rarely. This affects local culture and community traditions. Locals and history lovers are concerned and trying to preserve the bell-ringing tradition.
targetText: St. Martin’s bells ring less frequently due to fewer churches in Harlem. Locals are concerned and want to preserve this cultural tradition.

sourceText: Mr. Adams said that when he talked to elderly people about history, they said that earlier there used to be bars and churches on every corner. He said that at that time the community social and religious life was very vibrant. The elderly also shared that every bar and church used to be a center that connected people around them. Therefore, now that bars and churches have decreased, local traditions and community life are affected.
targetText: Elderly residents recall vibrant community life around bars and churches. The decline of these centers has weakened local social and cultural connections.

sourceText: "Today, everything is disappearing." Mr. Adams said this when mentioning the changing social and cultural conditions in Harlem. He meant that the earlier vibrancy and community connection is now gradually decreasing. This sentence reflects worry and sadness that traditions and local life are disappearing over time.
targetText: Mr. Adams expressed concern that Harlem’s cultural and social vibrancy is disappearing. Traditional community connections are fading over time.

sourceText: He said that the decline in bars is understandable. He meant that due to changing lifestyles and priorities, bars are decreasing. However, he also mentioned that this change affects the local community and social life. Therefore, even while accepting the decline in bar numbers, he emphasized the need to focus on their cultural and community importance.
targetText: Bars are declining due to lifestyle changes, but they remain culturally and socially important. Their role in the community should still be recognized.

sourceText: He said that nowadays society is being formed differently. It means that due to modern lifestyle and changing social habits, the traditional structure of the community is changing. He also feels that people now gather less at old corners, bars, and churches. Therefore, social connection and community life are not as before.
targetText: Modern lifestyles are changing traditional community structures. People gather less at bars and churches, weakening social connections.

sourceText: Bars are no longer like the neighborhood living room where people used to go every day. He meant that earlier bars were not just places to drink, but centers for meeting and conversation. Now the role of bars has changed and people no longer meet there daily, reducing community connection. This change affects local culture and traditional social life.
targetText: Bars used to serve as community hubs for conversation and connection. Their reduced role has weakened local culture and daily social life.

sourceText: For churches, their concern is that the money obtained from selling properties will not last as long as leaders expect. They say that soon this money will run out, or later those leaders will return to the same place from where they started. This indicates a kind of financial uncertainty and the possibility of the plan failing. Therefore, church representatives are cautious and want resources to be used thoughtfully and with a long-term perspective.
targetText: Church leaders are concerned that funds from property sales may not last. They emphasize careful, long-term planning for resources.

sourceText: They added that it is possible that churches have been converted into apartment buildings with ownership rights, where different kinds of people live who may not help protect the remaining nearby worship places.
targetText: Some churches have been converted into apartments, with residents unlikely to support nearby worship places. This raises concern for preservation.

sourceText: They said, 'The number of people buying homes with ownership rights in these buildings is increasing, and therefore at some point these churches will be completely closed, because it is unlikely that most of these owners will become members of these churches.'
targetText: As more apartments are sold, these churches may eventually close. New residents are unlikely to participate in church activities.

sourceText: The Methodist religious society original white people left in the 1930s. This caused a major change in the community’s cultural and social structure. After they left, activities and traditions in the church and neighborhood gradually decreased. Local people and historians now consider this change an important part of Harlems social and religious heritage.
targetText: The departure of the original white Methodist members in the 1930s changed Harlem’s social and cultural structure. Traditions and activities gradually declined.

sourceText: These buildings were taken over by black religious societies who used to worship at nearby places. This change brought new identity and activity to the community religious and social life. The black community developed these buildings as centers for cultural and religious programs. In this way, the center of social and religious activities shifted in the neighborhood and a new form of local life emerged.
targetText: Black religious societies took over the buildings, revitalizing community religious and cultural life. New centers for activities emerged, reshaping local social life.

sourceText: Under Father John Howard Johnson, a black religious society took over St. Martin, leading the removal of retailers from 125th Street. This area was a major shopping center in Harlem where black people faced opposition in getting jobs or promotions. This action increased business and employment opportunities for the local black community and improved their social status.
targetText: Father Johnson’s society took over St. Martin, removing retailers from 125th Street. This improved business and employment opportunities for Harlem’s black community.

sourceText: In 1939, a fire badly damaged this building. But Father Johnsons followers planned its reconstruction and soon began ringing the bell. This helped revive religious and social activities in the community. Bell ringing became an important part of tradition and community life there.
targetText: After a 1939 fire, Father Johnson’s followers rebuilt the building and resumed bell ringing. This revived religious and social community activities.

sourceText: Father Johnsons son and successor at St. Martin, Reverend David Johnson, proudly called the bell ringing work 'the opening of the door of fortune for the poor'. He believed that the sound of the bell would spread hope and symbol of opportunity in the community. This initiative helped increase social and economic opportunities for local poor and disadvantaged people. David Johnson said it was a symbol of both religious tradition and community support.
targetText: Reverend David Johnson saw bell ringing as spreading hope and opportunity. It symbolized religious tradition and improved social and economic opportunities for the poor.

sourceText: In July, a bell-ringing expert described it as 'a cultural heritage' and 'a priceless historical instrument'. He said the bell is not just a sound device, but a symbol of Harlem’s social and religious identity. Highlighting its importance, the expert said preserving it is necessary for future generations. This shows that the bell is not just a tradition, but part of the community historical and cultural heritage.
targetText: A bell expert called it a priceless cultural heritage and symbol of Harlem’s identity. Preserving it is vital for future generations.

sourceText: University of Michigan expert Tiffany Ng also emphasized that this was the first bell in the world played by black musician Dionisio A. Lind. She said Dionisio used to ring a very large bell at Riverside Church about 18 years ago. According to Ng, this historic initiative was very important for both music and cultural heritage. It means that black musicians played a crucial role in establishing their art and identity in Harlem and the broader community.
targetText: Tiffany Ng highlighted that Dionisio A. Lind was the first black musician to play this bell. This initiative was important for music, culture, and black identity in Harlem.

sourceText: Mr. Merriwether said that no one replaced his position at St. Martin. This means that his successor was not appointed immediately. This situation affected how responsibilities were distributed in the building and community. He said that despite this, religious and social activities continued.
targetText: No immediate successor was appointed at St. Martin, affecting responsibility distribution. Despite this, religious and social activities continued.

sourceText: In the last few months, what happened at St. Martin became a complex story of craftsmen and contractors. Some were appointed by the church general leaders, while others were chosen by the religious province. This mixed appointment system created multiple levels and different perspectives in work and responsibilities. As a result, maintaining project progress and coordination became quite complex.
targetText: St. Martin’s reconstruction involved multiple craftsmen appointed by different authorities. This created complexity in coordination and responsibilities.

sourceText: The parish formed by general leaders gained authority over the vestry (where worship items are kept). In July, the province expressed concern that it would demand cost completion from the vestry, even if the appointed craftsmen and contractors were not part of the appointment. This means a dispute over financial responsibility and control arose. This matter increased complexity in project management and decision-making between parish and province.
targetText: The parish gained authority over the vestry, causing disputes over financial responsibility with the province. This added complexity to project management.

sourceText: Some local priests complained about the lack of clarity from the province. They said that due to unclear decisions and guidelines, they were facing difficulties in their work. Priests believe that lack of clarity also affects community trust and effectiveness. Therefore, they demanded more transparency and accurate information from the province.
targetText: Local priests complained of unclear guidance from the province. They demand transparency to maintain community trust and effective work.

sourceText: A 13-year-old boy was injured by a shark attack while diving to catch crabs. The incident occurred in California on the opening day of lobster season when the boy was swimming in the water. The shark attacked suddenly, causing severe injuries and immediate need for help. Local officials and rescue teams acted quickly to safely pull the boy out of the water.
targetText: A 13-year-old boy was attacked by a shark while diving in California on lobster season opening day. Rescue teams quickly saved him from severe injuries.

sourceText: Officials said that on Saturday a 13-year-old boy was attacked by a shark and injured. At that time he was diving to catch crabs on the opening day of lobster season in California. The incident happened suddenly and the boy was pulled out of the water with serious injuries. Officials said such attacks are rare, but swimmers and divers should remain cautious in the sea.
targetText: A boy was attacked by a shark while crab-diving in California. Officials noted such incidents are rare but advised caution for swimmers and divers.

sourceText: The attack happened before 7 a.m. near Beacon Beach in Encinitas. At that time the sun had not fully risen and there was dim light in the sea. This place is usually visited early in the morning for swimming and water sports. The time and location of the incident made rescue and immediate response challenging.
targetText: The shark attack occurred before 7 a.m. at Beacon Beach, Encinitas, in dim light. Early timing made rescue and response more difficult.

sourceText: Chad Hammel told KSWB-TV in San Diego that on Saturday morning he was diving with friends for about half an hour. At the same time he heard a boy shouting for help. Immediately after that, he ran with a group to pull the boy out of the water. Hammel said that in this effort, everyone together ensured the boy safety.
targetText: Chad Hammel and friends rescued the boy after hearing his cries for help. Their quick action ensured his safety.

sourceText: Hammel said that at first he thought the boy was shouting in excitement for catching a crab, but then he realized the boy was screaming, 'Something is biting me!' This immediately made it clear that it was not just a game or joke, but a real warning of pain and danger. Hammel quick response helped prevent more serious injury to the boy.
targetText: Hammel initially thought the boy was joking but realized it was a shark attack. His quick response prevented more serious injury.

sourceText: Hammel said that when he saw the boy, he found that the boys entire throat was torn. This sight shocked and worried him. The situation was serious and dangerous, so immediate help was needed. Hammels report clearly shows the severity of the incident and the boys health condition.
targetText: The boy’s throat was severely injured in the shark attack. The situation was serious and required immediate medical attention.

sourceText: Hammel said, 'I shouted for everyone to get out of the water: there is a shark in the water!' His aim was to warn immediately and save people from danger. This incident trapped those present between fear and caution. Hammels quick reaction was crucial in ensuring safety from potential danger.
targetText: Hammel warned others about the shark, preventing further danger. His quick reaction ensured safety for everyone present.

sourceText: Sainsburys is now hiring expert assistants to provide better customer experience in beauty products. This step is part of Sainsburys plan to develop a large beauty section like a department store. Through this initiative, it is preparing to compete with big beauty stores like Boots, Superdrug, and Debenhams. Expert assistants will help customers choose the right products, advise on skincare and makeup, and contribute to improving customer experience.
targetText: Sainsburys is hiring expert assistants to improve customer experience in beauty products. This aims to compete with major beauty retailers and provide personalized advice.

sourceText: Sainsburys said that under this plan, the number of products will double because for the first time about 3,000 different beauty products will be made available in stores. For the first time, famous brands like Revlon, Essie, Tweezerman, and Dr. PawPaw have been included. This means customers can now buy products from these brands at Sainsburys stores.
targetText: Sainsburys will double its beauty product range to 3,000 items, introducing major brands like Revlon and Essie for the first time in stores.

sourceText: L'Oreal, Maybelline and Burts Bees products will now be more prominently available at Sainsburys. This means these products will have more opportunities at the level of branded products found in major beauty shops like Boots. Customers will now easily find these brands at Sainsburys stores and their accessibility will increase.
targetText: Popular brands like L'Oreal, Maybelline, and Burts Bees will be more accessible in Sainsburys, improving visibility and customer access.

sourceText: The supermarket is relaunching its boutique makeup products. The aim is that most of these products will be vegan-friendly. This could increase demand for these products among small retailers.
targetText: Sainsburys is relaunching boutique makeup, focusing on vegan-friendly products to boost demand and appeal to ethical consumers.

sourceText: In addition, perfume retailer Fragrance Shop will also test a special facility in two Sainsburys stores. The first store opened last week in Croydon, South London. The second store will open later this year in Selly Oak, Birmingham. The purpose of this test is to see how customers respond to perfume products and how successful the facility is.
targetText: Fragrance Shop is testing perfume facilities in two Sainsburys stores to gauge customer response and success of the initiative.

sourceText: Online shopping and the quantity of daily sold groceries in local convenience stores or supermarkets are decreasing. Because of this decline, customer visits to stores are also decreasing. Therefore, shopkeepers and supermarket operators are now trying harder to attract customers. Their aim is to increase customer visits and prevent a decline in sales.
targetText: Declining online and in-store sales have prompted supermarkets to implement strategies to attract more customers and boost visits.

sourceText: Sainsburys is now installing Argos outlets in hundreds of stores. Two years ago when the partnership between Sainsburys and Argos began, many stores were opened. This partnership has not only increased grocery sales but also made the deal more profitable. This means customers can now benefit from more convenience and products, and Sainsburys business has strengthened.
targetText: Sainsburys is expanding Argos outlets in stores, increasing convenience, product range, and profitability for the supermarket.

sourceText: The supermarket had previously tried to reintroduce beauty and pharmacy products in its stores. But that attempt was not successful and the plan did not fully succeed. This means that the previous effort did not increase sales and customer attraction as expected.
targetText: Sainsburys’ previous attempt to reintroduce beauty and pharmacy products failed to significantly boost sales or customer visits.

sourceText: Sainsburys partnered with Boots in the early 2000s. This partnership included Boots pharmacies inside Sainsburys supermarkets. But there was a problem regarding how revenue from pharmacy sales would be shared. Because of this, both companies had to end the partnership.
targetText: A previous partnership between Sainsburys and Boots ended due to disagreements over revenue sharing from in-store pharmacies.

sourceText: A murder investigation has been launched after a woman's body was found in Birkenhead, Merseyside this morning.
targetText: Police launched a murder investigation after a woman’s body was discovered in Birkenhead, Merseyside.

targetText: The 44-year-old woman was found stabbed at 7:55 a.m. and a 32-year-old man was arrested for murder.

targetText: Detective O’Hagan appealed for witnesses near John Street in Birkenhead to provide information on the murder.

targetText: Authorities urged anyone with dash cam footage, especially taxi drivers, to assist in the investigation.

targetText: Police confirmed the deceased woman was local to Birkenhead and found inside a property.

sourceText: Its banishment would be poetic justice for his Taliban-like destruction of so many of England's cultural and religious artefacts carried out by his fanatical Puritan followers.
targetText: Removing Cromwell's statue is seen by some as justice for his followers’ destruction of England’s cultural and religious artifacts.

sourceText: John Goldsmith, chairman of the Cromwell Society, said: ‘It was inevitable in the present debate about the removal of statues that the figure of Oliver Cromwell outside the Palace of Westminster would become a target.
targetText: Goldsmith noted that Cromwell’s statue at Westminster naturally became a focus in the broader debate on statue removals.

sourceText: Sir William Hamo Thorneycroft's magnificent representation of Cromwell is evidence of 19th century opinion and part of the historiography of a figure who many believe is still worth celebrating.
targetText: Thorneycroft’s statue reflects 19th-century views of Cromwell and represents a historical figure still admired by some.

targetText: Cromwell is historically seen as a defender of Parliament against the monarchy, more admired in the 19th century than today.

targetText: The mid-17th century conflict shaped the nation, with Cromwell symbolizing one side of the historical divide.

sourceText: A farmer was attacked and killed by a pig in a market in southwest China, according to local media reports.
targetText: A farmer in southwest China was killed in a shocking attack by a pig at a local market.

sourceText: The man, identified only by his surname Yuan, was found dead with a severed artery, covered in blood near a sty at the market in Liupanshui in Guizhou province, the South China Morning Post reported Sunday.
targetText: Yuan was found dead near a pigsty in Liupanshui with a severed artery, reportedly mauled by a pig.

sourceText: He had reportedly travelled with his cousin from the neighbouring Yunnan province on Wednesday to sell 15 pigs at the market.
targetText: Yuan had traveled with his cousin from Yunnan province to sell 15 pigs at the market.

sourceText: The following morning, his cousin found him dead, and discovered a door to a neighbouring pig sty open.
targetText: The next morning, Yuan’s cousin discovered him dead and noticed a nearby pigsty door open.

sourceText: A forensic examination confirmed that the 250 kg (550 pound) hog had mauled the farmer to death, according to the report.
